# Discord Chat Analysis: ðŸ’¬-discussion

## 1. Summary

The primary technical discussion centered on DigitalDiva's Discord bot integration issues with ElizaOS version 1.7.0. The bot was failing to recognize server IDs, throwing "No server ID found 10" errors related to the bootstrap plugin. The error logs showed issues with the transition from `serverId` to `messageServerId` in the codebase.

Odilitime diagnosed the problem as stemming from incomplete fixes in the 1.7.0 core release. He recommended either downgrading to version 1.6.5 or waiting for fixes. Shaw suggested debugging by creating a minimal Discord.js hello world script to isolate whether the issue was permission-related in the Discord developer portal versus code-related.

Odilitime actively worked on resolving the issue, creating a fix branch (odi-17) on GitHub with corrections for bootstrap's actions and providers that should work with plugin-discord 1.3.3. The solution involved addressing compatibility issues between the latest core version and the Discord plugin.

Secondary discussions included requests for better visibility of the ElizaOS contract address (CA) across official channels. Community members noted difficulty finding the correct CA, with suggestions for pinned tweets or website improvements. Kenk mentioned the linktree was being refreshed to point to CoinGecko for token information.

## 2. FAQ

Q: Why does the agent need admin privileges? (asked by Odilitime) A: DigitalDiva gave admin permissions when the bot wouldn't respond or see server ID and usernames (answered by DigitalDiva)

Q: What version of ElizaOS are you using? (asked by Odilitime) A: Version 1.7.0 with plugin-discord 1.3.3 (answered by DigitalDiva)

Q: Should I use version 1.6.5 instead? (asked by DigitalDiva) A: Yes, might be easier to use older core like 1.6.5, or use the odi-17 branch with fixes (answered by Odilitime)

Q: Why hasn't the ElizaOS contract address been posted across all official X accounts? (asked by degenwtf) A: The team will get on it, linktree is being refreshed to point to CoinGecko (answered by shaw and Kenk)

Q: If I buy ai16z now and migrate after 30 days, will I get 120X? (asked by nancy) A: If you buy after the snapshot (November 11), you can't migrate (answered by Omid Sa)

Q: Is the Babylon that a16z invested in related to ElizaOS? (asked by ElizaBAO) A: Nope (answered by degenwtf)

## 3. Help Interactions

Helper: shaw | Helpee: DigitalDiva | Context: Discord bot not responding or seeing server IDs | Resolution: Suggested creating minimal hello world script with discord.js to test if it's a permission issue in Discord dev portal, recommended logging env vars

Helper: Odilitime | Helpee: DigitalDiva | Context: "No server ID found 10" error with ElizaOS 1.7.0 and Discord plugin | Resolution: Diagnosed issue as serverId to messageServerId transition problem, recommended downgrading to 1.6.5 or created fix branch odi-17

Helper: Casino | Helpee: DigitalDiva | Context: Discord bot permission problems | Resolution: Suggested limiting scope/permissions and working back to desired features

Helper: Kenk | Helpee: S_ling Clement | Context: Looking to connect with person responsible for liquidity management | Resolution: Directed to connect with specific user for collaboration discussion

Helper: The Light | Helpee: henry | Context: Need help migrating tokens held in Tangem at snapshot time | Resolution: Directed to migration support channel

## 4. Action Items

Type: Technical | Description: Fix bootstrap plugin serverId to messageServerId transition issues in ElizaOS 1.7.0 | Mentioned By: Odilitime

Type: Technical | Description: Test and finalize odi-17 branch fixes for bootstrap actions/providers compatibility with plugin-discord 1.3.3 | Mentioned By: Odilitime

Type: Documentation | Description: Improve visibility and accessibility of ElizaOS contract address on official channels | Mentioned By: degenwtf, Broccolex

Type: Documentation | Description: Refresh linktree to point to CoinGecko for token information | Mentioned By: Kenk

Type: Feature | Description: Explore Polymarket-based agent plugins following Predict post mention | Mentioned By: meltingsnow

# Discord Channel Analysis: ðŸ’¬-coders

## 1. Summary

The channel discussion focused on two main technical topics. First, jin shared a GitHub resource from githubnext/agentics regarding workflow documentation for updating docs, noting it contained valuable information. 

The primary technical issue involved ElizaBAO encountering a "Model not found" error when integrating elizaoscloud agents into their website using agent IDs and API endpoints. The problem was resolved by cjft, who provided specific guidance on proper model parameter formatting for API endpoint calls. The solution required using provider-prefixed model names in one of three recommended formats: openai/gpt-4o-mini, anthropic/claude-sonnet-4.5, or google/gemini-2.5-flash. This formatting convention ensures the API correctly identifies and routes requests to the appropriate AI model provider.

## 2. FAQ

Q: How should I format the model parameter when calling agent API endpoints? (asked by ElizaBAO) A: Use provider prefix formats like openai/gpt-4o-mini, anthropic/claude-sonnet-4.5, or google/gemini-2.5-flash (answered by cjft)

## 3. Help Interactions

Helper: cjft | Helpee: ElizaBAO | Context: "Model not found" error when building elizaoscloud agents into website with agent IDs and API endpoints | Resolution: Provided correct model parameter formatting with provider prefixes (openai/, anthropic/, google/)

## 4. Action Items

Type: Documentation | Description: Review and potentially implement patterns from githubnext/agentics update-docs workflow | Mentioned By: jin

# Discord Chat Analysis - core-devs Channel

## 1. Summary

The discussion centered on critical bug fixes and architectural decisions for ElizaOS. Odilitime identified a significant issue in version 1.7.0 requiring an urgent release (PR #6333), though compatibility problems persisted with Discord 1.3.3, necessitating testing across multiple Discord branches and a new Discord release.

Stan submitted two plugin PRs for Telegram (#22) and Discord (#41) and shared documentation for review on HackMD. He provided a standup update detailing work on cloud fixes addressing TOCTOU (Time-of-Check-Time-of-Use) race conditions using a deduct-before, reconcile-after approach, plus runtime initialization optimizations with corresponding Linear tickets created.

A key architectural discussion emerged around connector gateways. Odilitime recommended reviewing the Jeju cloud branch containing Shaw's preferred Discord bridge implementation. The conversation evolved into scaling considerations, with Odilitime proposing simple event pumps as the direction forward. He emphasized the need for multiple daemon instances per service and differentiated requirements between voice connections (requiring higher bandwidth/priority event pumps) and text connections. Preprocessing was identified as a valuable optimization strategy.

Jin shared the ElizaOS book documentation on HackMD, confirming the existence of a team workspace.

## 2. FAQ

Q: Do we have a team or workspace on hackmd? (asked by Stan âš¡) A: Yes (answered by jin, sharing https://hackmd.io/@elizaos/book)

Q: So each problematic connector would need its own gateway? (asked by Stan âš¡) A: Direction is simple event pumps, and we'll need more than one daemon instance per service due to scale (answered by Odilitime)

## 3. Help Interactions

Helper: Odilitime | Helpee: Stan âš¡ | Context: Stan working on Discord connector implementation | Resolution: Recommended reviewing Jeju cloud branch with Shaw's preferred Discord bridge implementation at https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza-cloud-v2/tree/jeju/apps/discord-gateway

Helper: jin | Helpee: Stan âš¡ | Context: Stan asking about HackMD team workspace availability | Resolution: Confirmed existence and shared link to ElizaOS book workspace

## 4. Action Items

Type: Technical | Description: Rush out release with fix from PR #6333 for version 1.7.0 | Mentioned By: Odilitime

Type: Technical | Description: Test Discord fix with various Discord branches to resolve compatibility issues with Discord 1.3.3 | Mentioned By: Odilitime

Type: Technical | Description: Cut new Discord release after branch testing | Mentioned By: Odilitime

Type: Technical | Description: Implement cloud fixes for TOCTOU race conditions using deduct-before, reconcile-after approach | Mentioned By: Stan âš¡

Type: Technical | Description: Complete runtime initialization optimizations | Mentioned By: Stan âš¡

Type: Technical | Description: Plan scaling architecture for multiple daemon instances per service | Mentioned By: Odilitime

Type: Technical | Description: Design higher priority/bandwidth event pumps for voice connections versus text | Mentioned By: Odilitime

Type: Documentation | Description: Review documentation at https://hackmd.io/@0PzDTGXqRg6nOCDoEwaN-A/SyDNAAiVWe | Mentioned By: Stan âš¡
